utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Breakfast time!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! What did I do to deserve this? Other than, you know, being me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Isn’t that enough?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing! Why do I have to want something?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: March 1999. You wanted a Hello Kitty backpack. I got French toast with a whip cream smiley face. October 2004. You wanted a set of Empire Strikes Back mint condition light sabers. I got an omelet shaped like Darth Vader.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. I want a Vespa.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s a scooter. All my friends have them. And it would make getting around the city so much easier. And they’re totally safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, honey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll always wear a helmet and never drive at night. You know how responsible I am.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not you I’m worried about. Driving in New York… it’s like a Mad Max movie.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I really want this. Will you at least think about it? Please?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I will think about it. If you leave me alone so I can finish my breakfast.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, it’s Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ah. Remember what happened last time you went to a crime scene on a full stomach?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who is the unlucky winner today?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Deon Carver, bail bondsman. This is his office. He walked into a B and E last night and before he had a chance to use his registered firearm, our killer knocked him over the head with that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A sharpshooter award. That is ironic on so many levels. No, just two.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Our killer left a partial shoeprint in Carver’s blood, probably while wiping the trophy clean. The shoeprint is incomplete enough to tell the size, but the tread mark should be easy to identify.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then before leaving, our killer was nice enough to call 911 and leave the phone off the hook.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone was feeling a little guilty?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not too guilty. The call came in at eleven. I’m estimating time of death around ten.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means our perp had about an hour to ransack the place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looking for what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, money? I mean, bail bondsmen often get paid in cash, and ten percent of a million would be enough to tear up a place. Ryan and Esposito are taking a look around the building for any security cameras.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a negative on cameras.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would a calculator cause feedback?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a calculator. It’s a bug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A wireless RF transmitter, to be precise. Not to be confused with the more advanced infrared signal burst device.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Book research?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nanny cam. So … do you think that the robbery was just a pretense for the placement of the bug and then the killer was caught in the act?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s not Watergate, Castle. If the point was to bug Carver’s office, then why leave it here once he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, tell me this, Ms. Know-It-All. Who would want to bug a burly bail bondsman so badly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thank you. So it’s not law enforcement or a three letter agency. That bug was a commercial device. I contacted the manufacturer in Thailand. They’re looking up the serial number to see what store it was shipped to and hopefully from there we should find out who bought it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm… I remember when killers used to buy American.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I ran the shoeprint through the new federal database and matched the tread mark to these loafers here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, the no hassle tassel. These were the height of fashion … in 1984.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are photos of all of Carver’s clients with a history of violence. Can you show them around his building? See if anyone was there yesterday?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, you got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were a girl once.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still am.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you tell me why my daughter wants one of these so badly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, bikes are what girls want when we realize that we’re never going to get a pony.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you have one?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I still do. ’94 Harley soft tail. Worked all of high school to pay for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how did your parents feel about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, my dad threatened to send me to a nunnery. And my mom just shook her head and said, “Katie, every time you ride that thing just remember how much you hate hearing me tell you ‘I told you so’.” You know what this means, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Alexis is entering her wild child phase.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My daughter? Nah, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, Castle. All girls go through it. And good girls are the worst. In fact, I remember this one time when …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we located Carver’s wife, Brooke. She’s visiting her sister in Hoboken; uniforms are on their way to pick her up now. Oh, and Lanie called. She said she found something weird?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I found this hidden in Carver’s sock while I was stripping the body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. You’re the detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it’s what our killer was looking for in Carver’s office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously. That?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, it’s probably some complex code or –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The world’s least interesting doodle? It’s not something that you kill a guy over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did he hide it?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE CARVER
utterance.content: I told my husband, the kind of animals he dealt with every day, something bad was going to happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Carver, had your husband had any troubles with any of his clients recently?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Deon didn’t talk about work a lot with me. But he did say that he had to straighten someone out yesterday. He said it got pretty ugly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea who?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did your husband keep cash in his office?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: No, he insisted on money orders and cashier’s checks. He had a good heart but he wasn’t stupid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found this, folded up in your husband’s sock. Any idea what it is?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: No, I’ve never seen this before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just because she doesn’t recognize it doesn’t mean it’s not important. Brooke even admitted, Carver never even talked about work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, my spidey sense is tingling about this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I can’t base an entire murder investigation on your spidey senses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not? Our killer was looking for something. Our victim was hiding something. Res ipsa loquitur. It means –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The thing speaks for itself. I know. All I’m saying is that even though Carver didn’t keep cash in his offices, it doesn’t mean that it wasn’t an attempted robbery. I mean, these aren’t Mensa members we’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. Waitress in Carver’s building said she saw Carver and one of his clients get into a shouting match last night. Some scale named Random Pierce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody actually named their kid Random? No wonder he turned to a life of crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Random just did two years at Five Points Correctional and a week after he got out he was arrested for a B and E. That sounds like a real winner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Waitress said that she heard him tell Carver that if he didn’t give it back, that Random was going to take it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hum. I wonder what ‘it’ could be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Random had a court hearing scheduled for this morning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He didn’t know. They issued a bench warrant for his arrest at nine AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is Random’s last known address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you guys take the back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this Harley of yours, do you have any pictures?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I do, but I’m not going to be showing any of them to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, because I don’t think you can handle the sight of me straddling it in tight, black leather.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am so not getting a scooter for my daughter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Random.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Stop. Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve always wanted to do that!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing? That’s my suspect!

utterance.speaker: MIKE ROYCE
utterance.content: It’s okay, relax. We’re on the same team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Royce?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Hey kid. Long time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, too long.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice driving.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Ah, thanks. Mike Royce, bounty hunter. Boom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Richard Castle, writer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Royce used to be on the job.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: On the job? She says that like I’m any cop. I was her training officer when she left the academy.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Hey hey hey, if I’m imposing on your happy reunion, you know, I can just go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only place you’re going is jail.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: You know, I know a guy to get that dent out of your car. You let me go and I’ll give him a call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just shut up and get in the box.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: No wonder that guy was getting away. Look at your shoes! How many inches are those heels?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My shoes are fine. And he wasn’t getting away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, how’d you get the bounty on Random?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: I got a buddy at the courthouse. Random missed his hearing, I got a call. So you like this guy for murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, for his bail bondsman, Deon Carver.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Oh, I know Deon. I just did a skip trace for him last year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, we found a weird piece of paper in his sock. I’m thinking it’s some sort of code.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Only paper I’ve seen people kill for has pictures of dead presidents on it. Look, if Random’s not your guy, can I take him over to central booking, collect my bounty?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, if he alibis out. But I wouldn’t hold my breath on that. Castle, you coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Actually, I was going to hang back with Royce. Hear some stories about the good old days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. But if you tell him about the karaoke stakeout, I’m going to tell him what happened with the monkey.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: My lips are sealed.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: But I’ve got a lot of other stories.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: I wasn’t running away. I was jogging.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what were you doing climbing down the side of a building.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Cross training. Better cardiovascular workout.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Random, you did a stint at Five Points Correctional and within a week of your release you were breaking into someone’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: That was a misunderstanding. I wrote down my friend’s address wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? So what do you call killing Deon Carver? Mistaken identity?

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Deon’s dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice try. You have a history of breaking and entering, and I have a victim whose offices were ransacked, and you were seen arguing with Carver three hours before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: He invited me to dinner because he wanted to stress the importance of my appearance in court this morning. And seeing because he had 100k on the hook if I skipped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which you did.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: My alarm clock didn’t go off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or you were so exhausted after killing Carver that you slept right through it.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: C’mon! Three hours after we had dinner I was shoplifting at Book Mart uptown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You threatened someone’s life and then decide to shoplift a book.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Yes, well, I forgot to pay. I was so used to being in the prison library. I tried to tell the security guy that but he had me in some sort of ninja chokehold. Luckily for me, I was able to slip away before the cops came. Sucker. But that guard would totally remember me.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: No no, she’s got the cat in one hand, her gun in the other. I’m trying to get the hell out of the way so she can shoot the guy with a spear gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except Royce has such a giant head that every time I go to pull the trigger all I could think about how much paperwork I’ll have to do if I accidentally shoot him.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, so you know what she does? She offers to show the guy her boobs if he drops the spear gun.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Because he had the same slack jawed look that the two of you have.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Allowing me to take the guy down. But I’ll tell you what I realized in that moment. You gotta be ready for anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. I’m seeing a whole new side of you today - and feel free to show me more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you see what happens when you feed the animals?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So it looks like your shoplifter isn’t our killer after all. Guard at Book Mart confirms they caught him stealing a copy of The Da Vinci Code.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Da Vinci Code. Maybe he thought it could help him decipher the document, thinking it’s some kind of ancient religious cryptogram prophecying the coming zombie apocalypse.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Is he always like this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s usually about CIA conspiracies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was really close on one of those.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, do you want us to lock Random up? Store wants us to hold onto him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you let Royce take him down to Central; Book Mart can press charges over there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Thanks kid. I owe you one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t owe me anything and you know it.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Hey. Do me a favor and take a picture.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Of course.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: C’mon, for old time’s sake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So good to see you.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Stay sharp, kid. Rick. Don’t let her boss you around too much.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Hey, c’mon kitten. We’ve got a date a Central booking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He tells a terrific story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got a little bromance there, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wha-? No. What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay. He is pretty hard to resist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Why didn’t Royce and Beckett stay partners?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She moved up, he moved out. He did his twenty and put in his papers. I think he realized he wasn’t going to do any better than her. You know, I think Beckett is right about this. This doesn’t look like anything worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless it’s the lost secret to the Illuminati. Or Morse code.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Negative. All dashes, no dots.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys, you wanna hear something weird? We got a fingerprint hit from Carver’s office on a longtime felon named Clifford Stuckey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stuckey? Why do I know that name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s because it was Stuckey’s apartment that Random broke into when he got out of prison.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clifford Stuckey! NYPD, open up!

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD. Are you Clifford Stuckey?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clifford Stuckey!

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like you to come downtown and answer some questions about your break in.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: You’ll have to speak up, son. I dropped my hearing aid down the toilet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Beckett’s going to love him.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stuckey, I’m Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Ah, wish they had cops like you when I was getting in trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sir, could you tell us what you were doing in Mr. Carver’s office?

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deon Carver. He was a bail bondsman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was murdered last night. We found your fingerprints in his office.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Oh, him. Huh. What was the question?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carver posted bail for Random Pierce, the man who broke into your apartment. I need to know what you were doing in his office.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Do you believe an old dog can learn new tricks, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Neither did I. And then, I got old. You see, I’ve been a bad man most of my life. And now all my friends are dead, or in jail, and I’ve got nothing to show for my … my time here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stuckey? Carver’s office?

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Huh? Oh. When the police told me that boy had broken into my place, suddenly I … I saw myself forty years ago. And I thought, if somebody had just given me a break, maybe my life would have turned out differently. So I went to see what’s his name. Carver? And I told him that I would consider dropping the charges if that kid could convince me that he was, you know, willing to straighten his life out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: At home, asleep. Or as close as I ever get, having to pee every half hour. You should see the size of my prostate, son. It’s like a baby’s fist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, woah, thank you. Thank you, Mr. Stuckey. That’s good.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Hey. Hey, that’s the kid! Any idea where I can find him? My offer still stands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … I’m sorry, Mr. Stuckey. It’s too late. He’s already on his way back to jail.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Aw, geez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call me crazy, but I don’t think he was looking at Random’s picture. It was like he was checking out that document.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you mean the world’s least interesting doodle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I was just getting ready to cut open Carver’s skull when I saw it on his forehead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Saw what?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The light has to be at the right angle to catch the shine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sign of the cross?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I ran a test on the substance the cross was drawn with –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. Holy oil.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Holy oil?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like our killer gave Carver last rites.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, go back to bed. Breakfast is almost ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honey? Stop cooking for a second. I want to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’ve made a decision about the scooter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you ever heard of affluenza?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You mean influenza?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, affluenza. It’s a condition that affects children who come from wealthy homes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re making that up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not. It’s on Wikipedia.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You can’t believe everything you read online.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t. But the point is, you’re a great kid. I’m just afraid that if I just give you everything you want it’s going to warp your relationship with money.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So you’re saying no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – no, I’m not saying that. I’m saying that if you – if this is really important to you, then you need to earn the money yourself. And by earn I don’t mean raid your college fund.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you thanking me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because you said yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That … she would fold.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: This is Alexis we are talking about. She has never met a challenge that she hasn’t attacked like Attila the Hun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it would take her so long to –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She’ll have the money by next week. And then you know what you’re in for? You’re in for tattoos. You’re in for nose rings. You’re in for, oh, who knows what.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just how wild was your wild child phase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t wanna know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I may have a lead on our last rites killer. Our victim’s financials show he made several donations to a church in the south Bronx run by a Father Aaron Low. Ryan’s on his way to bring him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett? He’s here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No hassle tassels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the nature of your relationship with Deon Carver.

utterance.speaker: AARON LOW
utterance.content: He was a member of my congregation. And a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you two nights ago between nine and eleven?

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: I was at the church. We had a late service, then I went home to bed. I’m sorry, I have an appointment, so if you will excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Father, those are killer shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unfortunately, those are the same shoes worn by the man who killed Carver and I’m certain that if we sent those to the lab they’ll have Carver’s blood all over them.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Look, Deon was dead when I got there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Try again.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Look, I swear. I found him lying in his office. I administered last rites and then I dialed 911.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anonymously. And then you ran.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: There was nothing more I could do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why were you there in the first place?

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Deon was having marital troubles. I was helping him find his way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marital troubles. Are you sure you didn’t go there looking for this?

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: I don’t know what that is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lying is not his strong suit. A quality I like in a priest.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: I’m telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Father, you left the scene of a crime and a man you describe as a friend was murdered. If you didn’t have anything to hide you would have stayed.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: No, I was in shock. Look, there was so much blood all I could think to do was escape.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you murdered him.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: No! Because … because of how it looked. The convicts I work with tell me horror stories about the police, about how they’re framed. You know, when I found Deon like that I … I panicked. Am I ashamed? Yes. But you have to believe, I didn’t murder anybody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Father, you’ll have to forgive me, but this is a murder investigation. And I can’t base this on faith.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: It looks like you caught your killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: So? Was he trying to start the zombie apocalypse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mock all you want. Our good Father knows what that paper is.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Oh man, hey. I found this picture in my closet, though you’d get a kick out of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, look at you, all shiny and bright!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did I tell you about feeding the animals?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Listen, I just stopped by to say thanks again, for the bounty assist, and um… thought maybe I could buy you lunch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, it looks like the bug from Carver’s office was shipped from Thailand to a spy shop on Fifth Avenue. Guess who bought it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_CASTLE
utterance.content: Father Aaron.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Brooke Carver. Our victim’s wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Funny. She failed to mention that she was bugging her husband’s office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps the good Father was telling the truth about Carver’s marital problems. Nothing says ‘marriage on the rocks’ like electronic eavesdropping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But does it say murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s ask her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, um, why don’t you stop by after my shift. I’ll buy you a beer.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: It’s a date.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: We’d been fighting all the time. Some nights he wouldn’t come home. He said he was sleeping at the office, but I didn’t believe him. So I bought the bug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thought he was cheating on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you heard him in action, you decided to make yourself a widow.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: No, at first I couldn’t even bear to listen, I couldn’t bear to hear him with another woman. And finally I made my sister listen with me, but what we heard … it wasn’t sex. It was Deon talking about how much he loved me. And how he prayed that he could save our marriage. I cried all night. And in the morning I threw the receiver away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was that?

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: A few weeks ago. We had just started to find our way back to each other and now he’s dead. So now all I’ll have to remember him by is a box of ashes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Brooke’s sister confirms her story.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got about a dozen witnesses that put Father Aaron at church at ten PM when Carver was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’re back to square one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, the answer is right here in front of us, I can feel it. It’s just that there’s something that we’re not seeing, there’s a connection that we haven’t made yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you want me to start processing the good Father out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope. He might have an alibi, but he’s definitely involved somehow. It says here that Father Aaron volunteers at Five Points Correctional.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s where Random did his time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They knew each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And they both knew our victim. So maybe Five Points is our connection. Did Stuckey do time there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doesn’t mean they’re not connected in a different way. Prison’s a networking gold mine for criminals.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Out of curiosity, who was Random’s cell mate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … Malcolm Lloyd. A recidivist thief doing twenty for a jewel heist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We should go talk to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can’t. Looks like he died of a heart attack in prison three weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t it be funny if Father Aaron administered last rites for Lloyd as well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check Lloyd’s known associates.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Doesn’t mention the priest … wait a minute. It says Lloyd knew Clifford Stuckey. Looks like he and Lloyd were both arrested for the same jewel heist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They were partners.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: DA didn’t have enough evidence to prosecute Stuckey so he walked while Lloyd did twenty years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It still doesn’t explain why Random broke into Stuckey’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe this will help. The heist that Lloyd and Stuckey pulled? Ten million dollars in rare sapphires and rubies. And guess what. They were never found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You guys. I think I know what this is. It’s a treasure map.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Father, we checked with the prison. We know that you gave Malcolm Lloyd his last rites. That’s when you found out about the map.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: I administered to Malcolm at the end. He told me he was scared. That he wanted to do one good thing before he died. He made me promise that I would use it for the church. But when I went to the cell, the map wasn’t there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Random had already taken it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But when Random got out of jail, he couldn’t figure it out. So he breaks into Stuckey’s apartment, figuring he’s going to strong arm Lloyd’s old partner into helping him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only Stuckey wasn’t home and someone called the cops.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: I called them. I had been following Random and I knew that his arrest would give me the leverage I needed to force him to share the map.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you were friends with the bail bondsman.

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Random had no money for bail. Deon agreed to cover it for a third of the treasure but he insisted on holding onto the map for safe keeping.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why were you really at Carver’s office the night he died?

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Deon called me and told me that he had figured out the map. When I got there he was already dead. Murdered by that old man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stuckey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: LOW
utterance.content: Because Stuckey had caught Deon and Random conspiring together the night before. He told them he had waited twenty years for that money and they had twenty four hours to give it back or bodies were going to start dropping.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Stuckey. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re never going to hear the end of this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Aw, crap.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When do Esposito and Ryan get back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Soon. They’re on their way to Central booking to pick up Random to ask him about the map. So I made a couple of phone calls and this heist in 1990 was worth ten million dollars, and now it’s worth almost thirty million.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Hey, you ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wo – you – uh, you can’t leave now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon Castle, every uniform in this city’s got Stuckey’s photo. If there’s one thing that my TO taught me it’s that sometimes the best way to crack a case is by taking a break.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Promise I won’t keep her out too late.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: So, it’s actually a treasure map, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle’s been trying to figure it out all day. I should have been on to Stuckey earlier, though.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Nobody’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You were easy to impress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I wasn’t. I was drowning, and … you were dry land. All they ever taught us in the academy was how to do paperwork. You were the one who taught me how to be a cop.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You were easy to teach. Keeping you out of trouble, not so much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trouble? Me?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: What about that biker chick from Yonkers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I got her to snitch on her crew, didn’t I?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: By offering me up as man bait!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, you should have seen your face when she told the judge ‘he completes me’.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: That’s mean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I caught him, Royce. The man who killed my mom.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: After all these years. Find out why he did it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody paid him to do it, but I had to shoot him before I could find out who.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: That was stupid.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You shoulda just shown him your boobs.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I got the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The light sabers. I found a guy on eBay willing to pay two grand for them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we had so much fun with those! We were saving the universe, one galaxy at a time. That’s what got you into fencing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know, dad. But I’ve outgrown them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, yeah, I guess … I guess you have.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you mad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no I … I’m frustrated over this case.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is that the map?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And it’s making me doubt my own genius. There’s just something I’m not seeing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can I take a look?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. Found it folded up in our victim’s sock.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s got a lot of fold marks on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Almost like a puzzle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Or one of those paper fortune tellers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or MAD Magazine. Uh, MAD Magazine used to have this trick picture on the back. If you folded it the right way it would show you an entirely different image.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, there’s a word there. The.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under. Under the… … gun. Under the gun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Under the gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under the gun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I should get going. They’re going to be bringing Random into the precinct.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: I’m just going to head out then.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s Ryan. We’re at Central booking. Random isn’t here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean he’s not there? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. Your buddy Royce never delivered him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t believe he lied to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Money makes people do crazy things. Look at any reality show contestant who ever ate a cockroach on television. Doesn’t mean he killed Carver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, until I find otherwise I’m going to have to assume that he did. Do you think he came here to see the map like Stuckey did?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When I took the picture of the two of you, you were standing in front of the murder board.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He has a copy of the map.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but obviously he can’t figure it out. That’s why he was here. He wanted to see if we did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. I pulled the files from the jewelry heist. Your boy Royce was part of the investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he knew about the treasure from the start.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We put a surveillance on his apartment and an APB out on his car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about ‘under the gun’? Any idea what that means?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. There was a gun club about five blocks from the jewel heist, but it was torn down and turned into condominiums about ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right then. Keep looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: It’s me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Royce, turn yourself in.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: I can’t do that, kid. I’m too close to the money to walk away right now. Listen, I just need you to know that I didn’t mean for it to go like this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you kill Carver for the map?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: C’mon kid, you know me better than that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think I do. Because the man that I knew wouldn’t betray me like this.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mike. I was in love with you.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Oh, Kate. Don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were the only one that understood the obsession that drove me. Who didn’t tell me that I would get over my mother’s murder and that she wouldn’t want me to do this.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Just … just trying to do right by you, kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I dreamt about you. The night that I shot the guy who killed my mother. I dreamt that I was the one who was on the ground, dying. And that you came up to me and told me, ‘stand up’. Because there was still work to be done. When I woke up that morning I just wanted to call you, but we hadn’t talked in so long.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You shoulda called. I never forgot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to catch Carver’s killer, Royce. And then I’m going to recover Lloyd’s score. And when I arrest you you’re going to realize that what you destroyed today was worth a hell of a lot more than money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did I keep him on long enough?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh… um…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. We got an address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wha … all that was just an act to get a trace?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! It’s clear.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Oh… thank God! That dude totally kidnapped me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knock it off. We already know about the map.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Royce?

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Out looking for my money. Looks like he betrayed all of us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Random, either you start telling us the truth or Esposito is going to hang you out that window by your feet.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Look, I’m a victim in all this. I bunked with a geezer who wouldn’t shut up about his ten million dollar score. How he buried it where no one could find it. Not without the map. But then I had to partner with Carver and the creepy priest, and instead of trying to figure out the map all they wanted to do was argue about how un-Christian it was to cut Carver’s wife out of the score.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This argument. Did it take place in Carver’s office?

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which Brooke had bugged.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call Ryan, have him find Brooke.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She didn’t hear him profess his undying love for her. She heard him trying to cut her out of millions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then she lied to our faces.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Marriage on the rocks. A fortune in rocks. Two strong motives for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We showed her the map.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No wonder her hands were trembling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan traced Brooke to Carver’s office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RANDOM
utterance.content: Hey hey hey … what about me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have a cheese puff. Uniforms are on their way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no one here. We just missed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was trying to recreate the map from memory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at this. Notes she took while she was listening in on the bug. Right here – under the gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She heard them figure it out. But without the map, she can’t find the treasure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s because the score could be buried anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it can’t be. New York is basically an island of concrete. Lloyd would have to make sure he buried it someplace that couldn’t be torn down or dug up to make condos.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The park, maybe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or a cemetery. Didn’t Brooke say Carver was being cremated? So why does she have cemetery brochures?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Those weren’t lines on the map. Those were gravestones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Want to bet it’s buried ‘under the gun’?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, if this were a horror movie, we’d be the first ones killed, splitting off like this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, except we’re not a couple of top heavy co-eds out looking for fun. We’re highly trained officers of the law with enough firepower to take out a hoard of undead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hispanic and cocky. Yeah, you’d definitely die first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if this was a horror movie –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, focus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… there it is, look! Look! Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like someone’s been here already.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Drop the gun!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: Then we’ve got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not a cop killer, Brooke. I know you didn’t mean to kill Deon. He just surprised you when you were looking for that map.

utterance.speaker: BROOKE
utterance.content: To hell with that. Of course I meant to kill him. After ten years of putting up with his foot fetish and snoring, he betrays me like that? Uh uh. I deserve that treasure. And I’m not leaving here without it.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: Only one leaving with that treasure is me. And I’ve got the biggest gun.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Not anymore, grandpa.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! NYPD! Drop it right now, stupid!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! NYPD! Drop your weapon! What’s wrong with you? Drop it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about you, Royce? You willing to shoot me for that treasure?

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: In case you haven’t noticed, kid, my gun’s not pointed at you.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: But my gun is and at this range I’m going to turn her and the haircut into soup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You shoot you die, gramps.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: You think I care? The only thing that’s keeping me alive is that ten million in stones. Either I leave with it or I leave in a body bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then maybe we should make sure that treasure is even there before we start shooting. Castle, do you mind?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you’re the only one without a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good point.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: You got a plan, kid?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not one that I plan to share with you.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Maybe you should show us all something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Hey guys? I think I found something.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Just like old times, huh kid?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop your gun, now.

utterance.speaker: STUCKEY
utterance.content: The treasure. Let me see the treasure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I just - I just said that to distract you. It was either that or show them my boobs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got Royce?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROYCE
utterance.content: Go ahead, kid. Do what you have to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Michael Royce, you’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, hello? Doesn’t anyone want to see if there is actually a treasure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe there wasn’t actually a treasure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe we read the map wrong. Maybe it was all a wild goose chase. Either way, case is closed. Hey, how is Beckett holding up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hard to see your heroes fall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I just say how unsatisfying it is to go on a treasure hunt with no treasure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it wasn’t really a treasure hunt, Castle. It was a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. You can’t tell me you weren’t just a little bit excited.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe a little.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. What’s bugging me though, is if there was no treasure, then why make a map?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s a big cemetery. Maybe he got the spot wrong. Or maybe ‘under the gun’ was just to throw us off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if it was me, I would have left something out of the map. A last step.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you think there was another map?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I would have kept it somewhere close to me. Somewhere where only I knew that … that it was important.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somewhere like on my body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think this is the final part of the map?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What else could be important enough for our jewel thief to tattoo it on his arm? Okay, uh, Roman numerals. Two over a six. I’m going to say that means two rows up, six stones over from where we dug. You care to do some digging, Detective?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well … did you find it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, we did!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Unfortunately, when you go treasure hunting with a cop, she makes you return the treasure to its rightful owner. But uh, the evening wasn’t a total loss. When we found it she did give me a sweaty hug.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what are you girls doing? You picking out a color for your shiny new scooter?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Tell him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I decided not to get the scooter. I realized once I left the precinct how wrong it was for me to sell those light sabers, but I was so caught up in wanting the bike that I convinced myself that I was just trading one thing for another. But playing pretend with you was one of the best parts of my childhood and it means more to me than a shiny new scooter ever could.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Proud enough to buy me a new scooter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I made a deal, and it would be wrong to break it. But there’s nothing in that deal that prohibits me from buying myself a scooter and maybe letting you borrow it from time to time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. I can send you to the store for batteries for light sabers.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks dad. Oh, and when you have the scooter maybe I can borrow the car.
